<h3 id="X37671">X(37671)&nbsp;=&nbsp; X(2)X(6)&cap;X(30)X(76)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; 2*a^4 - a^2*b^2 - b^4 - a^2*c^2 - 4*b^2*c^2 - c^4 : :
<p>
Let A'B'C' be the 5th Brocard triangle and let B<sub>A</sub> and C<sub>A</sub> be the orthogonal projections of B' and C' on BC, respectively.  Define C<sub>B</sub>, A<sub>B</sub>, A<sub>C</sub>, B<sub>C</sub> cyclically.  X(37671) is the centroid of B<sub>A</sub>C<sub>A</sub>C<sub>B</sub>A<sub>B</sub>A<sub>C</sub>B<sub>C</sub>.  (Randy Hutson, March 29, 2020)
</p>
<p>
X(37671) lies on these lines:  {2, 6}, {3, 32820}, {5, 7768}, {20, 32869}, {30, 76}, {32, 6661}, {99, 8703}, {115, 7848}, {140, 7796}, {262, 34380}, {264, 428}, {311, 34603}, {315, 381}, {316, 3845}, </p>
<p>
X(37671) = isotomic conjugate of X(14492)<br>
X(37671) = complement of X(7837)<br>
X(37671) = anticomplement of X(9300)<br>
X(37671) = {X(2),X(69)}-harmonic conjugate of X(7788)<br>
</p>
